content: How I built an AR user manual in 7 days
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: Duration 7 days My Role Everything
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: Demo Video
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: Tech Stack Development - C#, Unity3D, Vuforia 3D Modeling - Rhino3D Design - Adobe XD, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: Problem In this project, I chose the user manual as my design subject. First, I did a simple field study to find common problems people encounter when using user manuals. Based on these qualitative data, I listed some hypothetical design goals to help me build a general direction for my later user research. Problem" Problem
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: User Research To get a comprehensive understanding of manual users, I designed a survey and published it on a survey site. A total of 102 replies were collected, of which 100 were valid. Here are some key findings. User Research" User Research
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: Ideation In this phase, I used the Insights, Quesitons, Ideas (IQI) method to help me generate design concepts Insights, Questions, Ideas" Insights, Questions, Ideas
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: Storyboard A visual representation of this product Storyborad" Storyborad
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: Development Development" Development
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: Usability Test Usability Test" Usability Test
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: Takeaways The geometric complexity of the product will affect Vuforia‚Äôs tracking performance. So for electronic products with minimal design style, it‚Äôs pretty hard for Vuforia to track them accurately Users' external constraints like room lighting, space, and camera quality may cause a poor user experience. So, there are some technical issues to be solved Vuforia‚Äôs 2D tracking performance is so much better than 3D? During the usability test, users had a strong inclination to interact with virtual buttons, so enriching the virtual experience is very important for user experience Force users to download an AR app to experience it may not be the best solution, gonna try Web AR next time and learn Three.js
title: AR User Manual - UI/UX - AR

content: How I built a WeChat Mini Program in 30 days
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Duration - 1 month My Role UI/UX Designer, Developer
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Demo Video
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Repo
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Tech Stack Design - Adobe XD, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop Front End - JavaScript, WXML, WXSS Back End - Python Development - WeChat Mini Program SDK, VSCode Visualization - Apache ECharts
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Problem In this project, I took COVID-19 as the topic. I started with the HMWs to find problems and design opportunities. Based on the problem‚Äôs importance, social impact, and creativity. I chose precautions as my starting point. HMWs" HMWs
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Experience Mapping I drew an experience map to help me establish a baseline understanding of an ordinary person‚Äôs experience when searching for COVID-19 precaution information. Experience Mapping" Experience Mapping
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: User Research To better understand the behaviors and pain points of potential users. I designed a survey based on the experience map, then published it on a survey site. I received 210 replies, of which 193 were valid. Here are some key findings. Findings" Findings
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Product Strategy Based on the survey data I received, 78% of survey takers mainly use social media, like WeChat to gain information about COVID-19. So WeChat Mini Program is a good place to share this information. Also, we can use the user‚Äôs internal social network on WeChat to promote our app. Product Strategy" Product Strategy
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Information Architecture Before starting to design the interface, I firstly specified the information architecture because it‚Äôs going to save more time in the future. I listed all the resources and pages I need to build this app and prioritized them. Information Architecture" Information Architecture
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Hi-Fi Prototype After completing the information architecture, I started to work on the user interface and visual design. Hi-Fi Prototype" Hi-Fi Prototype
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: UI Spec UI Spec" UI Spec
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Developement I developed this project using WeChat Min Program SDK. I also used a Python crawler to collect COVID-19 data, such as COVID cases, relevant videos, and FAQs from multiple websites. Finally, I deployed the beta version of this app on the WeChat platform. Development" Development
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: Takeaways There are some differences between development and design. Designers and developers should have a basic understanding of each other‚Äôs work to collaborate seamlessly. Optimization is very important when fetching and rendering huge datasets.
title: Covid Kit - UI/UX - Full Stack

content: NTU Entrepreneurship Proejct, team of 5
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Duration - 3 months My Role - UI/UX Designer My Team - 2 developers, 1 UX researcher, 1 PR
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Âç°‰ºØ(Cardbo)
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Our Team Disclaimer iRewards is my latter redesigned version of Cardbo(Âç°‰ºØ), which uses the same research results, not the published version on Line. Our beta version was‚Ä¶ too shabby
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Tech Stack Design - Adobe XD, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Problem In Taiwan, people love using credit cards. One may have 6-15 credit cards because each has a different reward policy. For those users, it may be a headache to them when choosing which credit card to pay for stuff. So our product aims to solve this problem. Problems" Problems
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: User Research To better find users' pain points, we collected quantitative data from 264 people using SurveyCake, and interviewed 15 people online to gather qualitative data. Here are some key findings. User Research" User Research
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Persona Based on the users' data we collected, there are two types of users. The Petty Bourgeoisie and the Credit Card Enthusiast. We created personas for them to better understand their lifestyles and behavior patterns. Persona" Persona
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Ideation This is my own part of ideation. HMWs" HMWs
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Wireframe I prefer creating wireframes directly in photoshop using my drawing tablet because drawing gives me more freedom than pulling boxes inside Figma. Wireframe" Wireframe
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Information Architecture Based on the refined version of wireframes, I built the information architecture. Information architecture is a very good way to connect with developers because it shows the whole structure of the application, so developers can start arranging some basic components and logic. Information Architecture" Information Architecture
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: UI Spec Here is my favorite design part. UI Spec" UI Spec
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Prototype
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Give it a try! Prototype" Prototype
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Usability Test I invited 3 tester to test this app. Here are the results. Usability Test" Usability Test
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: Takeaways Don‚Äôt ask questions continuously during user interviews Give users some thing to try or play with Turn WHY questions into WHAT questions
title: iRewards - UI/UX

content: My graduation industrial design project
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Tech Stack 3D Modeling - Rhino3D, Keyshot Design - Sketchbook, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Problem Campus commute has always been a problem for Chinese students, especially when some of the Chinese universities started to expand their campus area or merge with another nearby university. In this project, I focus on transportation tools of college students aiming to design a new concept to solve this problem.
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Field Study I did a field study on how college students use campus transportations like shared bicycles. Besides, I also noticed that college students use food delivery services a lot, so there are some outside delivery riders on the campus too. Field Study" Field Study
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Stakeholder Analysis I identified the 4 most important stakeholders inside the campus traffic ecosystem Stakeholder" Stakeholder
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Stakeholder Relationship Understanding their conflicts of interest can help me identify the most important problem to solve. Stackholder Relationship" Stackholder Relationship
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Ideation Prioritize the possible solutions. Ideation" Ideation
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Sketch My favorite part. Sketch" Sketch
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Modeling Less favorite part. 3D Modeling" 3D Modeling
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Storyboard This is the final concept storyboard. Storyboard" Storyboard
title: Fastgo - Industrial Design

content: Service design proejct, team of 5
title: Bridge - UI/UX

title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Demo Video
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Tech Stack Design - Adobe XD, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Problem In this project, we focused on elderly life. Since we are a team, we started by brainstorming and HMWs. Later, we all decided on an innovative problem, which is the senior immigrants' acculturation. HMWs" HMWs
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: User Rsearch We conducted 6 offline interviews with seniors who happened to have international immigration or domestic migration experiences (It‚Äôs really hard to find people with this kind of experience who happens to be a senior). Based on our interviews, we used the user spectrum to categories their behavior patterns and lifestyles. User Spectrum" User Spectrum
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Persona We decided to use A‚Äôs lifestyles and behavior patterns and created a persona for type A users. Her name is Mary(ÁæéÈí∞). Persona" Persona
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Empathy Mapping To better empathize with Mary, we created an empathy map for her. Empathy Mapping" Empathy Mapping
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Value Proposition Canvas Value proposition canvas is a very good tool for teams to brainstorm ideas and at the same time keep everyone aligned with the user. Value Proposition Canvas" Value Proposition Canvas
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Wireframe Wireframe" Wireframe
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Information Architecture Information Architecture" Information Architecture
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: UI Spec Here comes my favorite part! UI Spec" UI Spec
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Takeaways Use large font size in elderly products Functionality must be simple and straight-forward Keep interactive logic simple
title: Bridge - UI/UX

content: Who I am Howdy! I‚Äôm Alex üëã An Industrial designer turned software engineer. I have a passion for both design and software development. I believe that excellent products come from the harmony between design, engineering, and a human-centered mindset. Currently, I‚Äôm a graduate student at UT Austin and am looking for 2022 summer internships.

Tech I use Languages - Java, Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, C/C#, HTML/CSS/SASS JavaScript Libraies - NodeJS, ExpressJS, ReactJS, NextJS, P5JS, ThreeJS, Apache Echarts, EJS Database - PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB Cloude - AWS, Firebase, MongoDB Atlas OS - MacOS, Pop!OS(Linux) Coursework - Operating Systems, Algorithms, Data Mining, Database Management, AI in Health Design - Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Rhino3D, Keyshot

Education University of Texas at Austin Master of Science in Information Science/Studies 2021 - persent | National Taiwan University of Science and Technology Bachelor of Design in Industrial Design 2016 - 2020

Awards KYMCO Motorcycle Design Competition, Finalist Transportation Design 2020 + Corning Future Innovator Competition, Merit Award Product Design (10,000 TWD) 2018 + Corning Future Innovator Competition, Merit Award Product Design (10,000 TWD) 2017
Interests Tech -Config my Vim, Mechanical Keyboard Sports -Table Tennis, Fitness Music -Math Rock, Electric, Jazz Fusion, J-Rock
